Detailed Description

Object that can be used to read and write the bits of a floating point number.

Floating point numbers are composed of three sections: sign, exponent, and mantissa. These sections are laid out like so:

0 00000000 00000000000000000000000
^ \------/ \---------------------/
| | |
\ 8-bit exponent |
\ 23-bit mantissa
sign bit

This object provides functions for reading and writing these sections of a floating point number.

otherBitwiseFloat to copy from.

bool chaos::data::BitwiseFloat::operator== ( const BitwiseFloat &  other) const

Equality operator.

Compares whether this BitwiseFloat and the other BitwiseFloat are considered equal.

Equality is defined by a comparison of the exact BitwiseFloat.int_rep values.

For more flexible floating point comparisons see chaos::math::float_equals().

bool chaos::data::BitwiseFloat::operator!= ( const BitwiseFloat &  other) const

Inequality operator.

Compares whether this BitwiseFloat and the other BitwiseFloat are considered not equal.

Equality is defined by a comparison of the exact BitwiseFloat.int_rep values.

For more flexible floating point comparisons see chaos::math::float_equals().

void chaos::data::BitwiseFloat::set_mantissa ( chaos::uint32  mantissa)

Sets the 23-bit mantissa section of this floating point number.

Note
While a 32-bit input value is accepted only the least significant 23-bits of this value will be used.
float chaos::data::BitwiseFloat::precision_away_from_zero ( ) const

Returns the precision of this float away from zero.

Floating point precision is measured as the difference between this number and the next possible float value away from zero.

Exceptions
chaos::ex::ArithmeticErrorIf this float is infinity or NaN.
float chaos::data::BitwiseFloat::precision_towards_zero ( ) const

Returns the precision of this float away from zero.

Floating point precision is measured as the difference between this number and the next possible float value towards zero.

Exceptions
chaos::ex::ArithmeticErrorIf this float is 0 or NaN.
